text: 300px Christ on the Cross, Christ between Two Thieves or Calvary is an 1835 painting by Eugène Delacroix. It was exhibited at the 1835 Paris Salon, after which it was bought for the French state for 2,000 francs and assigned to Morbihan. It was then exhibited at the church of Saint-Patern in Vannes, where the curé had the breast of Mary Magdalene overpainted and the work hung out of sight in the bell tower. The painting was restored in 1864 and the following year moved to its present home at the Musée de la Cohue, also in Vannes. ==References== Category:1835 paintings Category:Paintings by Eugène Delacroix Delacroix category:Paintings of the Virgin Mary Category:Paintings depicting Mary Magdalene Category:Skulls in art
title: Christ on the Cross (Delacroix)
